intro: Pedicularis alopecuros, commonly known as the beard tongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its spurred flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or moist soil conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, are adapted for pollination by bees and other insects. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
